form.current-chamber: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

action.action-desc: Mr. Daines (for himself, Ms. Ernst, Mr. Cramer, Mr. Sheehy, Mr. Lee, Mr. Budd, Mr. Risch, and Mr. Crapo) introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the Committee on Commerce, Science, and Transportation

form.official-title: To prohibit the Administrator of the Federal Motor Carrier Safety Administration from issuing a rule or promulgating a regulation requiring certain commercial motor vehicles to be equipped with speed limiting devices, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Deregulating Restrictions on Interstate Vehicles and Eighteen-wheelers Act or the DRIVE Act.

section.header: Prohibition on requiring speed limiting devices
section.text: Notwithstanding any other provision of law, the Administrator of the Federal Motor Carrier Safety Administration may not issue any rule or promulgate any regulation to require a commercial motor vehicle (as defined in section 390.5 of title 49, Code of Federal Regulations (or a successor regulation)) to be equipped with a speed limiting device set to a maximum speed.
